stories.title: Repository Inventory And Operational Surface

Report summarizes high-level structure, critical entry points, and unknown areas
Report includes concrete evidence paths and risk notes
stories.notes: Passive audit only. No code changes. Detailed execution plan is defined via objective/steps/verification/out_of_scope.
stories.objective: Run an iterative, evidence-first deep audit for 'Repository Inventory And Operational Surface' using small scan passes and severity-based triage.

steps.title: Preflight: Scope and boundaries
actions: Confirm active story AUDIT-001 and repository-relative scope boundaries.
Limit inspection strictly to: **/*, !**/.git/**, !**/node_modules/**, !**/vendor/**.
expected_evidence: Scope-boundary statement in report method section.
List of included/excluded areas for this pass.
done_when: Audit boundary is explicit and reproducible.

steps.title: Inventory pass: Files and entry points
actions: Enumerate repository structure and identify runtime/automation entry points.
Capture unknown ownership or unclear operational zones for follow-up.
done_when: High-signal inspection targets are clearly identified.

steps.title: Deep scan pass A: Broken logic and will-break patterns
actions: Inspect line-by-line for broken logic, invalid assumptions, and fragile runtime behavior.
Capture potential will-break issues with concrete path evidence.
expected_evidence: Evidence references with file paths and lines where possible.
done_when: All high-risk logic defects are captured or explicitly ruled out.

steps.title: Deep scan pass B: Unfinished, stubs, skeleton code
actions: Look for TODO/FIXME/HACK markers, placeholders, partial implementations, and fake/stub responses.
Record incomplete behavior and latent feature gaps.
done_when: Incomplete implementations are explicitly documented.

steps.title: Deep scan pass C: Dead ends, slop, duplication
actions: Identify dead code paths, orphaned exports/files, copy-paste duplication, and excessive complexity.
Flag maintainability risks that likely amplify defects over time.
expected_evidence: Noted hotspots for complexity or duplication.
done_when: Maintainability findings are concrete and prioritized.

steps.title: Triage pass: Severity and impact classification
actions: Consolidate findings and assign severity by impact and confidence.
Deduplicate overlapping findings while preserving evidence.
expected_evidence: Deduped issue set with no contradictory entries.
done_when: Findings are ordered and ready for stakeholder consumption.

steps.title: Quality gate: Contract and safety checks
actions: Cross-check acceptance criteria and ensure report output contract is satisfied.
Ensure no secret/raw sensitive values are exposed in findings text.
done_when: Report is contract-compliant and safe to persist.

steps.title: Finalize report for iterative handoff
actions: Publish concise context, method, findings, risks, and next-step signals.
Ensure output can feed directly into subsequent linting/fixing stories.
expected_evidence: Clear transition notes for next iteration.
done_when: Report is complete and iteration-ready.

verification: Findings are evidence-backed with concrete paths and line anchors where possible.
Broken-logic, unfinished/stub, dead-end/slop, and will-break categories were checked explicitly.
Severity ordering is explicit and auditable.
No repository modifications were performed.

steps.title: Preflight: Resolve check surface
actions: Collect runner-detected best-effort commands for LINT-001.
If no commands are detected, prepare explicit no-op execution rationale.
expected_evidence: Detected command list or no-op declaration.
done_when: Execution set is explicit before command runs start.

steps.title: Execution plan: Order and prerequisites
actions: Define deterministic command order and note missing dependencies/tooling.
Record constraints that may affect reproducibility.
done_when: Every command has an execution or skip reason.

steps.title: Run pass A: First half of command set
actions: Execute first subset of detected lint/test commands in read-only mode.
Capture exit status and concise, high-signal output excerpts.
expected_evidence: Per-command status entries for pass A.
done_when: Pass A outcomes are fully logged in report notes.

steps.title: Run pass B: Remaining command set
actions: Execute remaining command subset sequentially.
Capture status and key outputs with same structure as pass A.
expected_evidence: Per-command status entries for pass B.
Symmetric reporting structure across all commands.
done_when: All detected checks have consistent outcome reporting.

steps.title: Analysis pass: Failure classification
actions: Group failures by severity, subsystem, and probable impact.
Separate tooling/setup failures from code-quality failures.
done_when: Failure triage order is defensible and explicit.

steps.title: Reproducibility pass: Re-runability notes
actions: Document reproducibility details: commands, assumptions, and blockers.
Map likely ownership areas via path/package context where possible.
expected_evidence: Known uncertainty markers where evidence is incomplete.
done_when: Another engineer can reproduce key outcomes quickly.

steps.title: Parity pass: Local vs CI alignment
actions: Quickly note likely local-vs-CI parity risks relevant to this linting story.
Flag drift sources (versions, setup, workflow differences).
done_when: Parity status is clear enough for follow-up action.

steps.title: Finalize linting report
actions: Publish deterministic report with command summary, findings, risks, and next steps.
Ensure no repository edits were performed.
done_when: Linting report is complete and iteration-ready.

steps.title: Preflight: Select smallest fix slice
actions: Choose the minimal high-confidence defect slice for FIX-001.
Defer larger or ambiguous changes to later iterations.
done_when: Planned fix batch is intentionally small and safe.

steps.title: Boundary gate: Scope and risk constraints
actions: Reconfirm allowed edit scope: README*, docs/**, **/*.md.
Lock out broad refactors and architecture/security redesign work.
expected_evidence: Explicit non-goals for this fix iteration.
done_when: Edit boundary is precise before making changes.

steps.title: Fix cycle 1: Apply first micro-change
actions: Apply the first documentation-only micro-fix with minimal textual churn.
Avoid introducing new policy/process claims not grounded in current repo evidence.

done_when: First defect slice is resolved or explicitly blocked.

steps.title: Fix cycle 1 validation
actions: Run targeted check(s) for the first change.
Capture pass/fail outcome and residual observations.
expected_evidence: Residual note if not fully resolved.
done_when: Cycle 1 has explicit verification evidence.

steps.title: Fix cycle 2: Apply second micro-change (if needed)
actions: Apply next smallest in-scope fix only when still within risk budget.
Skip this cycle if no additional safe fix remains.
expected_evidence: Optional cycle-2 change entry with rationale.
Reasoned skip note when cycle 2 is not executed.
done_when: Second cycle decision is explicit and justified.

steps.title: Fix cycle 2 validation (if executed)
actions: Run relevant validation for cycle 2 edits.
Record outcomes with same structure as cycle 1.
expected_evidence: Cycle-2 validation status or explicit N/A.
done_when: All executed fix cycles have verification evidence.

steps.title: Consolidated checks: Best-effort rerun snapshot
actions: Refresh and run relevant best-effort checks after micro-fix cycles.
Capture any newly surfaced or remaining failures.
done_when: Post-fix status is clear for closure decision.

steps.title: Diff hygiene and scope audit
actions: Ensure final change set stays minimal, deduplicated, and in-scope.
Highlight any blocked high-risk items intentionally left untouched.
done_when: No accidental spillover changes remain.

steps.title: Finalize fixing report and handoff
actions: Write deterministic report with what changed, what passed, and what remains.
Provide safe next iterative actions for unresolved items.
done_when: Fixing report is complete and handoff-ready.

verification: All edits stayed within story scope and remained minimal.

Resolved vs remaining issues are clearly split.

out_of_scope: Large refactors not required by acceptance criteria.
